message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.IR 

This paper discusses the methodological and conceptual challenges of analyzing large-scale databases of human activity in social media. It addresses issues related to the validity and representativeness of social media big data analyses, which are central to the field of social informatics (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the use of network methods in the study of human social activity, which falls under the category of complex systems (cs.CY) and social and information networks (cs.SD). The paper's focus on the socio-cultural complexity of user behavior and the challenges of accounting for field effects suggest that it may also be relevant to the sub-categories of social and economic systems (cs.SOC) and information retrieval (cs.IR).
